oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Women in Higher Education Since 1970: The More Things Change, the More They Stay the Same
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gerdes, Eugenia Proctor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Senior women looking back over their careers noted the increased presence of women, changes in policies or behavior, and/or improvements in beliefs or attitudes.Â However, almost half also noted family problems that remain for women, and about two-thirds described biases against women that remain a part of higher education today.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Education Leadership Research Center, Texas A&M University
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Advancing Women in Leadership Journal; Vol. 21 (2006 Summer)
